name: Configurer l'infrastructure DevOps avec Docker, K3s, Jenkins et Grafana pour serveurs Linux
description:
Ce workflow automatisÃ© n8n fournit un kit d'outils DevOps instantanÃ© en installant Docker, K3s, Jenkins, Grafana, et plus sur un serveur Linux en moins de 10 secondes. Il optimise les performances, amÃ©liore la sÃ©curitÃ© et fournit des modÃ¨les prÃªts Ã  l'emploi pour les projets DevOps.

## Composants principaux
- **Configurer les paramÃ¨tres** - DÃ©finit les dÃ©tails du serveur, les versions des outils et les identifiants
- **PrÃ©paration du systÃ¨me** - Met Ã  jour le systÃ¨me et installe les paquets de base
- **Installer Docker** - DÃ©ploie Docker Engine et Docker Compose
- **Installer Kubernetes** - Configure le cluster K3s avec kubectl, Helm et k9s
- **Installer Jenkins** - Configure le serveur CI/CD Jenkins avec intÃ©gration Docker
- **Installer la surveillance** - DÃ©ploie Prometheus et Grafana en utilisant des charts Helm
- **CrÃ©er un utilisateur DevOps** - Ã‰tablit un utilisateur dÃ©diÃ© avec les autorisations appropriÃ©es
- **Configuration de la sÃ©curitÃ©** - Met en Å“uvre un pare-feu, VS Code et Terraform
- **Configuration finale** - Configure des projets d'exemple et des fichiers de configuration
- **Configuration terminÃ©e** - Fournit un rÃ©sumÃ© et des dÃ©tails d'accÃ¨s

## PrÃ©requis essentiels
- Serveur Linux avec accÃ¨s SSH
- PrivilÃ¨ges administratifs au niveau root

## Guide de personnalisation
- Ajustez les versions des outils ou les identifiants dans le nÅ“ud Configurer les paramÃ¨tres
- Modifiez le nombre de nÅ“uds ou les paramÃ¨tres de sÃ©curitÃ© selon vos besoins

## FonctionnalitÃ©s
- ðŸ”§ **Outils DevOps principaux installÃ©s :**
  - Docker - Plateforme de conteneurs avec Docker Compose
  - Kubernetes - K3s (lÃ©ger) avec kubectl et Helm
  - Jenkins - Serveur d'automatisation CI/CD
  - Prometheus - Surveillance et alertes
  - Grafana - Visualisation et tableaux de bord
- âš¡ **Optimisations effectuÃ©es :**
  - Commandes rationalisÃ©es - Combinaison de plusieurs opÃ©rations en scripts bash uniques
  - RÃ©duction des nÅ“uds - 10 nÅ“uds contre 12 dans l'original (plus efficace)
  - Meilleure gestion des erreurs - Chaque Ã©tape inclut une vÃ©rification
  - PrÃªt pour le cloud - Inclut AWS CLI, Azure CLI et Google Cloud SDK
  - SÃ©curitÃ© d'abord - Configuration appropriÃ©e du pare-feu et des autorisations utilisateur

## ParamÃ¨tres Ã  configurer
- server_host: L'adresse IP de votre serveur Linux
- server_user: Nom d'utilisateur SSH (gÃ©nÃ©ralement 'root')
- server_password: Mot de passe SSH
- docker_version: Version de Docker Ã  installer
- k3s_version: Version de K3s Ã  installer
- username: Nom d'utilisateur DevOps
- user_password: Mot de passe pour l'utilisateur DevOps

## Comment utiliser
- Copiez le code JSON de l'artefact
- Ouvrez votre espace de travail n8n
- SÃ©lectionnez "Importer depuis JSON" ou "+" â†’ "Depuis JSON"
- Collez le code JSON
- Configurez les paramÃ¨tres dans le nÅ“ud "Configurer les paramÃ¨tres" avec les dÃ©tails de votre serveur
- ExÃ©cutez le workflow

## Actions du workflow
- Installer : DÃ©ploie Docker, K3s, Jenkins, Prometheus et Grafana avec optimisations
- CrÃ©er un utilisateur : Configure un utilisateur DevOps avec les autorisations nÃ©cessaires
- Configurer : Applique les paramÃ¨tres de sÃ©curitÃ© et fournit des modÃ¨les

workflow.name: Automate Full DevOps Infrastructure Setup on Linux Server in Just 10 Seconds

parameters.command:
#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸš€ DevOps Stack Setup - System Preparation"
echo "=========================================="

# Update system
apt update -y && apt upgrade -y

# Install essential packages
apt install -y curl wget git vim nano build-essential software-properties-common \
    apt-transport-https ca-certificates gnupg lsb-release jq unzip tree htop \
    net-tools python3 python3-pip openssh-server ufw

# Install Python packages for automation
pip3 install ansible boto3 kubernetes docker-compose

echo "âœ… System preparation completed!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ³ Installing Docker & Docker Compose"
echo "===================================="

# Add Docker GPG key
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg

# Add Docker repository
echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

# Install Docker
apt update && apt install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io

# Install Docker Compose
curl -L "https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/latest/download/docker-compose-$(uname -s)-$(uname -m)" -o /usr/local/bin/docker-compose
chmod +x /usr/local/bin/docker-compose

# Start Docker service
systemctl start docker && systemctl enable docker

echo "Docker version: $(docker --version)"
echo "Docker Compose version: $(docker-compose --version)"
echo "âœ… Docker installation completed!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "â˜¸ï¸ Installing Kubernetes (K3s)"
echo "=============================="

# Install K3s (lightweight Kubernetes)
curl -sfL https://get.k3s.io | INSTALL_K3S_VERSION="v{{ $json.k8s_version }}.0+k3s1" sh -

# Install kubectl
curl -LO "https://dl.k8s.io/release/$(curl -L -s https://dl.k8s.io/release/stable.txt)/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl"
install -o root -g root -m 0755 kubectl /usr/local/bin/kubectl

# Install Helm
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helm/helm/main/scripts/get-helm-3 | bash

# Install k9s (Kubernetes CLI management tool)
curl -sS https://webinstall.dev/k9s | bash

# Wait for K3s to be ready
sleep 30

echo "Kubernetes version: $(kubectl version --client --short)"
echo "Helm version: $(helm version --short)"
echo "âœ… Kubernetes installation completed!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ”§ Installing Jenkins"
echo "===================="

# Add Jenkins repository
wget -q -O - https://pkg.jenkins.io/debian/jenkins.io.key | apt-key add -
echo "deb https://pkg.jenkins.io/debian-stable binary/" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/jenkins.list

# Install Java (required for Jenkins)
apt update && apt install -y openjdk-11-jdk

# Install Jenkins
apt install -y jenkins

# Start Jenkins
systemctl start jenkins && systemctl enable jenkins

# Install Jenkins plugins via CLI (optional)
wget http://localhost:8080/jnlpJars/jenkins-cli.jar

# Create Jenkins Docker integration
usermod -aG docker jenkins

echo "Jenkins installed! Access at: http://$(hostname -I | awk '{print $1}'):8080"
echo "Initial admin password: $(cat /var/lib/jenkins/secrets/initialAdminPassword)"
echo "âœ… Jenkins installation completed!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ“Š Installing Prometheus & Grafana"
echo "=================================="

# Create monitoring namespace
kubectl create namespace monitoring

# Add Prometheus Helm repository
helm repo add prometheus-community https://prometheus-community.github.io/helm-charts
helm repo add grafana https://grafana.github.io/helm-charts
helm repo update

# Install Prometheus using Helm
helm install prometheus prometheus-community/kube-prometheus-stack \
    --namespace monitoring \
    --set prometheus.prometheusSpec.serviceMonitorSelectorNilUsesHelmValues=false \
    --set prometheus.prometheusSpec.retention=30d

# Install Grafana using Helm
helm install grafana grafana/grafana \
    --namespace monitoring \
    --set persistence.enabled=true \
    --set persistence.size=10Gi \
    --set adminPassword=admin123

# Expose services
kubectl patch svc prometheus-kube-prometheus-prometheus -n monitoring -p '{"spec":{"type":"NodePort"}}'
kubectl patch svc grafana -n monitoring -p '{"spec":{"type":"NodePort"}}'

echo "Prometheus & Grafana installed!"
echo "Prometheus: http://$(hostname -I | awk '{print $1}'):$(kubectl get svc prometheus-kube-prometheus-prometheus -n monitoring -o jsonpath='{.spec.ports[0].nodePort}')"
echo "Grafana: http://$(hostname -I | awk '{print $1}'):$(kubectl get svc grafana -n monitoring -o jsonpath='{.spec.ports[0].nodePort}')"
echo "Grafana admin password: admin123"
echo "âœ… Monitoring stack installation completed!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ‘¤ Creating DevOps User & Configuration"
echo "======================================"

# Create DevOps user
useradd -m -s /bin/bash {{ $json.devops_user }}
echo "{{ $json.devops_user }}:{{ $json.user_password }}" | chpasswd

# Add to groups
usermod -aG sudo,docker {{ $json.devops_user }}

# Create directories
su - {{ $json.devops_user }} -c "mkdir -p ~/projects/{docker-files,k8s-manifests,jenkins-pipelines,monitoring,scripts}"

# Copy kubeconfig
cp /etc/rancher/k3s/k3s.yaml /home/{{ $json.devops_user }}/.kube/config
chown -R {{ $json.devops_user }}:{{ $json.devops_user }} /home/{{ $json.devops_user }}/.kube

# Generate SSH key
su - {{ $json.devops_user }} -c "ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C '{{ $json.devops_user }}@devops-server' -N '' -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa"

# Configure Git
su - {{ $json.devops_user }} -c "git config --global user.name '{{ $json.devops_user }}'"
su - {{ $json.devops_user }} -c "git config --global user.email '{{ $json.devops_user }}@devops.local'"

echo "âœ… DevOps user created successfully!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸ”’ Security & Firewall Configuration"
echo "==================================="

# Configure UFW firewall
ufw --force enable
ufw allow 22/tcp      # SSH
ufw allow 80/tcp      # HTTP
ufw allow 443/tcp     # HTTPS
ufw allow 8080/tcp    # Jenkins
ufw allow 9090/tcp    # Prometheus
ufw allow 3000/tcp    # Grafana
ufw allow 6443/tcp    # Kubernetes API

# Install additional DevOps tools
snap install code --classic
snap install helm --classic
snap install terraform --classic

# Install AWS CLI
curl "https://awscli.amazonaws.com/awscli-exe-linux-x86_64.zip" -o "awscliv2.zip"
unzip awscliv2.zip && ./aws/install

# Install Azure CLI
curl -sL https://aka.ms/InstallAzureCLIDeb | bash

# Install Google Cloud SDK
echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg] https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt cloud-sdk main" | tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-cloud-sdk.list
curl https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt/doc/apt-key.gpg | apt-key --keyring /usr/share/keyrings/cloud.google.gpg add -
apt update && apt install -y google-cloud-cli

echo "âœ… Security configuration completed!"

#!/bin/bash

echo "ðŸŽ¯ Final DevOps Stack Configuration"
echo "==================================="

# Create sample DevOps project structure
cat > /home/{{ $json.devops_user }}/projects/docker-compose.yml << 'EOF'
version: '3.8'
services:
  app:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
  
  redis:
    image: redis:alpine
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
      
  postgres:
    image: postgres:13
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_DB=myapp
      - POSTGRES_USER=user
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=password
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
      
volumes:
  postgres_data:
EOF

# Create sample Kubernetes deployment
cat > /home/{{ $json.devops_user }}/projects/k8s-manifests/deployment.yaml << 'EOF'
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: sample-app
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: sample-app
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: sample-app
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: nginx:alpine
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: sample-app-service
spec:
  selector:
    app: sample-app
  ports:
    - protocol: TCP
      port: 80
      targetPort: 80
  type: LoadBalancer
EOF

# Create sample Jenkins pipeline
cat > /home/{{ $json.devops_user }}/projects/jenkins-pipelines/Jenkinsfile << 'EOF'
pipeline {
    agent any
    
    stages {
        stage('Build') {
            steps {
                echo 'Building application...'
                sh 'docker build -t myapp:${BUILD_NUMBER} .'
            }
        }
        
        stage('Test') {
            steps {
                echo 'Running tests...'
                sh 'docker run --rm myapp:${BUILD_NUMBER} npm test'
            }
        }
        
        stage('Deploy') {
            steps {
                echo 'Deploying to Kubernetes...'
                sh 'kubectl apply -f k8s-manifests/'
            }
        }
    }
}
EOF

# Set proper ownership
chown -R {{ $json.devops_user }}:{{ $json.devops_user }} /home/{{ $json.devops_user }}/projects/

# Display summary
echo "ðŸŽ‰ DevOps Stack Setup Complete!"
echo "=============================="
echo "ðŸ“Š Installation Summary:"
echo "â€¢ Docker: $(docker --version)"
echo "â€¢ Kubernetes: $(kubectl version --client --short)"
echo "â€¢ Helm: $(helm version --short)"
echo "â€¢ Jenkins: http://$(hostname -I | awk '{print $1}'):8080"
echo "â€¢ Prometheus: http://$(hostname -I | awk '{print $1}'):9090"
echo "â€¢ Grafana: http://$(hostname -I | awk '{print $1}'):3000"
echo "â€¢ DevOps User: {{ $json.devops_user }}"
echo "â€¢ Password: {{ $json.user_password }}"
echo "â€¢ Project Directory: /home/{{ $json.devops_user }}/projects/"
echo ""
echo "ðŸš€ Your DevOps environment is ready for CI/CD!"
echo "Happy DevOps! ðŸŽ¯"

string.name: tools_installed
string.value: Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Prometheus, Grafana, Helm, Terraform

parameters.content:
## Main Components
- **Configure Parameters** - Defines server details, tool versions, and credentials
- **System Preparation** - Updates the system and installs base packages
- **Install Docker** - Deploys Docker Engine and Docker Compose
- **Install Kubernetes** - Sets up K3s cluster with kubectl, Helm, and k9s
- **Install Jenkins** - Configures Jenkins CI/CD server with Docker integration
- **Install Monitoring** - Deploys Prometheus and Grafana using Helm charts
- **Create DevOps User** - Establishes a dedicated user with appropriate permissions
- **Security Configuration** - Implements firewall, VS Code, and Terraform
- **Final Configuration** - Sets up sample projects and configuration files
- **Setup Complete** - Provides a summary and access details

user.name: Oneclick AI Squad
user.bio: The AI Squad Initiative is a pioneering effort to build, automate and scale AI-powered workflows using n8n.io. Our mission is to help individuals and businesses integrate AI agents seamlessly into their daily operations  from automating tasks and enhancing productivity to creating innovative, intelligent solutions. We design modular, reusable AI workflow templates that empower creators, developers and teams to supercharge their automation with minimal effort and maximum impact.
